item.title: How to easily clear the window.applicationCache on select browsers
item.description: How to 'easily' clear application cache (cache manifest) data for Chrome, and Safari on i-devices.

item.title: HTML5 / LocalStorage Web application manager tool
item.description: I've created a Web application manager tool, which can be used to display information about a domain's local storage usage, amongst other things.

item.title: Interesting feature with parsing XML with jQuery on Safari
item.description: Interesting results on parsing XML with jQuery on current versions of various browsers.

item.title: Code cleanup and commenting - done right
item.description: Looking for freelance work in Web code cleanup and commenting - where does one start?

item.title: Using a standard template to create a simple Web site
item.description: As stated in a previous article, there's a site, http://blog.html.it/layoutgala/, that offers free templates. Using these templates, you can easily create a site, so long as you have the content you need to fill the pages. In this article, we'll be putting some content into one of these templates, Layout 34, but we can use the methods we discuss here on any of the templates.

item.title: Google Code: Web Authoring Statistics
item.description: A look at HTML code from December of 2005.

item.title: 'Just enough HTML to be dangerous'
item.description: This time, we'll be covering the minimum HTML knowledge required to be truly dangerous. While an expanded understanding of HTML is not, per se, required, having at least some understanding will help in a number of ways. Of course, the more HTML you know, the less you rely on tools to do the work (which is a good thing, since we're not always able to use the tools that we're familiar with).

item.title: Found: 40 free HTML/CSS templates
item.description: Alessandro Fulciniti, along with an unnamed number of people, have create 40 CSS-based templates, free for download, available at http://blog.html.it/layoutgala/.

item.title: Don't use ul when you should use blockquote
Can we blame hosts for their poor HTML editors?
item.description: A short article on HTML editors provided by Web site hosts.
